text: This is a list of the titles related to Datuk, or its variant spelling Dato, Dato' or Datu, used in Brunei and Malaysia as titles which are conferred together with certain orders (). It may exist in itself as a single-word title, or as the prefix in a string of title such as "Dato Paduka" and "Datuk Seri Panglima". A female recipient on her own right generally receives the title whereby the word "Datuk" (or its variant spelling) is replaced with "Datin" instead. The wife of a Datuk holder also receives a title and it is typically "Datin" (regardless of the husband's full title); the husband of a female recipient does not receive any Datuk title. == Usage == === Brunei === In Brunei, only the variant spelling "Dato" (without apostrophe) is used. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+List of Dato titles in Brunei !Title !Order (Class) !Post-nominals |- |Dato Hamzah Pahlawan |Order of Pahlawan Negara Brunei (Second Class) | |- | rowspan="2" |Dato Laila |Order of Paduka Keberanian Laila Terbilang (Second Class) | |- |Order of Paduka Laila Jasa Keberanian Class) | |- |Dato Seri Utama |Family Order of Seri Utama | |- |Dato Setia |Order of Setia Negara Brunei (Second Class) | |} === Malaysia === In Malaysia, the variant spellings "Datuk", "Dato'" (with apostrophe), "Dato" (without apostrophe) and "Datu" are used. ==== as "Datuk" ==== "Datuk" is conferred by the Yang di-Pertuan Agong, the federal sovereign of Malaysia, as well as the non-royal state leaders with the exception of Penang. {| class="wikitable sortable mw-collapsible" |+List of Datuk titles in Malaysia !Title !Order (Rank) !Name in Malay !Post-nominals !Type |- | rowspan="6" |Datuk ==== as "Dato" ==== "Dato" (without apostrophe) is only conferred by the Yang di-Pertua Negeri of Sarawak for certain ranks of the Most Exalted Order of the Star of Sarawak. {| class="wikitable" !Title !Order (Rank) !Name in Malay !Post-nominals |- |Dato |Most Exalted Order of the Star of Sarawak (Commander) | | |- |Dato Sri |Most Exalted Order of the Star of Sarawak (Grand Commander) | | |} ==== as "Datu" ==== "Datu" is only conferred by the Yang di-Pertua Negeri of Sarawak for the Order of Meritorious Service to Sarawak. {| class="wikitable" !Title !Order !Name in Malay !Post-nominals |- |Datu |Order of Meritorious Service to Sarawak | | |} == See also == * Malay styles and titles == References == == External links == * List of orders and medals of Brunei Darussalam * List of
